The '''''Golden Book''''' ([[Quenya|Q.]]''Parma Kuluina'') was a book about the history of the [[Elder Days]], kept by the Elves of [[Tol Eressëa]] in their city of [[Kortirion]]. [[Pengolodh]] consulted the Golden Book when compiling the ''[[Quenta Silmarillion]]''. [[Eriol]]/[[Ælfwine]] was allowed to read the ''Parma Kuluina''.<ref>{{LR|Quenta}}, pp. 201, 203-4</ref><ref>{{SM|Q0}}, p. 78</ref><ref>{{SM|VC}}p. 274</ref>

==Etymology==
''Parma Kuluina'' is [[Quenya]] for "Golden Book", consisting of ''[[parma]]'' ("book") + ''kuluina'' ("orange; of gold, golden").<ref>{{VT|36a}}, p. 23</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2416186741.html|articlename=MQ. ''Parma Kuluina'' pn.|website=[[Eldamo]]|accessed=}}</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
The earlier [[Qenya]] name of the Golden Book was rendered as ''Parma Kuluinen'',<ref>{{LT2|VI}}, p. 310</ref> Consisting of ''[[Parma]]'' ("skin, bark; parchment; book, writings") from the root PARA.<ref>{{LT2|Appendix}}, entry "Parma Kuluinen"</ref> It was also known as the '''Golden Book of [[Heorrenda]]'''<ref>{{LT2|VI}}, pp. 283-90</ref>
